diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: bacterial meningoencephalitis, syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion (SIADH)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Acute neurological presentation in a previously healthy child with fever, high inflammatory markers, sepsis physiology, and hyponatraemia suggested bacterial meningoencephalitis. Catecholamine-resistant shock with hyperpigmentation prompted investigation for adrenal insufficiency. The rapid neurological recovery with a normal CT scan after treatment indicated cerebral oedema was due to hyponatraemia and adrenal insufficiency.
